name: Lemon Garlic Baked Ricotta
description: Super fast and easy to make, a fabulous dip / spread for your next party! Keep the topping garnishes simple or as creative as you want - I've provided some suggestions below.
recipeIngredient: 2 cups of full fat ricotta (, the best you can afford)
1 to 3 tbsp full fat cream or milk (, optional (only required if you aren't using fresh Italian ricotta))

recipeInstructions.text: Place the ricotta in a bowl. If you are using supermarket ricotta (as opposed to fresh Italian ricotta), it might be a bit dry. Use the cream or milk to loosen the ricotta into creamy "peanut butter" type consistency (ie. easily spreadable).
recipeInstructions.name: Place the ricotta in a bowl. If you are using supermarket ricotta (as opposed to fresh Italian ricotta), it might be a bit dry. Use the cream or milk to loosen the ricotta into creamy "peanut butter" type consistency (ie. easily spreadable).

recipeInstructions.text: Add the lemon, garlic and salt and mix to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the lemon, garlic and salt and mix to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Get to 1 cup capacity ramekins or any other oven proof dish (I used tapas dishes). Divide the ricotta between the dishes and drizzle over 1 tbsp olive oil (reserve other tbsp for after baking).
recipeInstructions.name: Get to 1 cup capacity ramekins or any other oven proof dish (I used tapas dishes). Divide the ricotta between the dishes and drizzle over 1 tbsp olive oil (reserve other tbsp for after baking).

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until the top is lightly browned.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until the top is lightly browned.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven, drizzle with remaining 1 tbsp olive oil then serve immediately with toasted pieces of bread (tip: rub lightly with garlic - it's amazing!).
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oven, drizzle with remaining 1 tbsp olive oil then serve immediately with toasted pieces of bread (tip: rub lightly with garlic - it's amazing!).

itemListElement.text: Fresh thyme, parsley or any other herbs, finely chopped (pictured)

review.reviewBody: Hi Nagy..a bit disappointed as it would not "golden up" for me even with extra time.I would overdo the flavour ingredients next time as it was very subtle.Elegant though and I loved the tomato/thyme garnish.Thanks

I have made whey ricotta with the whey left over from making mozzarella but I have never tried making more ricotta from my left over ricotta whey!!! I am going to have to try this. :-)
Pretty excited to try the ricotta whey as if I don't make bread with it, I often throw it out. Cool to get two batches of cheese from it. Thanks for the tip Cheryl.

I love ricotta made with lemon juice, but I don't always have them in the house...too many G&T's ;-) I read someone say you can use the bottled lemon juice but I have never tried it. Do you use fresh juice?
